epd_owner.name: Holcim (Australia) Pty Ltd
epd_owner.address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia

epd_produced_by.name: Edge Environment Pty Ltd
epd_produced_by.address: Level 3, Greenhouse, 180 George Street, Sydney NSW 2000 Australia

epd_process_certified_by.name: Epsten Group
epd_process_certified_by.address: Suite 2600, 101 Marietta St NW, Atlanta, Georgia 30303, USA

epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.product_use: General use concrete including foot paths, slabs, foundations, normal class concrete

product_classes.normal_class: Designed for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths
product_classes.special_class: High-strength/high-performance concrete, high durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural off-form finishes and decorative applications

hazardous_substances.notes: None of the products contain substances listed in the Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern for authorisation

product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)
databases_and_software.notes: Environmental impacts from existing EPDs do not include EN15804+A1 and additional Green Star impact categories; these are modelled separately

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight or m3 of concrete; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to and from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered via trucks and ships without packaging

data_quality.assessment: Good or very good geographic and temporal representativeness
data_quality.background_data_timeliness: All data updated within 10 years as required under PCR 2019:14

processes_included.upstream: Extraction, transport and manufacturing of raw materials; generation of electricity for modules A1 and A3
processes_included.core: External transportation of materials, manufacturing of concrete (excluding mixing), treatment of waste and wastewater
processes_included.downstream: Distribution, installation, wastage of construction products, transport and treatment of waste at end of life

installation.assumptions: Based on industrial expertise and GCCA tool; includes pouring from truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation activities

deconstruction.method: Physical process of drilling and removing concrete using hydraulic excavator

targets.2030: Embodied carbon of all construction materials to be at least 40% lower
targets.2050: All new construction materials to be net zero

carbonation.description: Natural process of CO2 absorption by concrete over its lifetime, offsetting some emissions

allocation_method.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included
allocation_method.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Allocated economically due to significant economic value
allocation_method.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.database_allocation: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted for secondary data and processes
recycled_materials_handling.recycled_aggregate_use: Recycled aggregate replaces virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

additional_info.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative Guidelines (2023)
British Standards Institution EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 and BS EN 16757:2017
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water National Waste Report 2022
EPD International General Programme Instructions and PCR documents (2024)
Man Yu et al., Procedia Engineering, 2017
